data.chText: 赞扬（或称颂）…为…（尤用于报章等）
data.enText: to describe sb/sth as being very good or special, especially in newspapers, etc.

data.chText: 会议被称颂为一次巨大的成功。
data.enText: The conference was hailed as a great success.

data.chText: 因救起一名溺水儿童，少年马特∙布朗被誉为英雄。

data.hoverText: 动词+名词短语+名词短语

data.enText: Teenager Matt Brown is being hailed a hero for saving a young child from drowning.

data.chText: 招手（请出租车或公共汽车停下）
data.enText: to signal to a taxi or a bus, in order to get the driver to stop
to hail a taxi/cab
to call to sb in order to say hello to them or attract their attention

data.chText: 街对面有个声音招呼我们。
data.enText: A voice hailed us from the other side of the street.
when it hails , small balls of ice fall like rain from the sky
It's hailing!
hail from…
to come from or have been born in a particular place
His father hailed from Italy.
small balls of ice that fall like rain

data.chText: 我们顶着冰雹和大雪开车。
data.enText: We drove through hail and snow.

data.chText: 一阵像冰雹般袭来的事物；雹子般的一阵
data.enText: a large number or amount of sth that is aimed at sb in order to harm them
a hail of arrows/bullets
a hail of abuse

word_means: 一阵像冰雹般袭来的事物

means: 一阵像冰雹般袭来的事物
赞扬(或称颂)…为…(尤用于报章等)
招手(请出租车或公共汽车停下)

ex.chText: 他们热烈欢呼大会开幕。
ex.enText: They warmly acclaimed the opening of the conference.

ex.chText: 人们欢呼称颂他这一历史性决定。

synonyms.bx: 指因某人或某事成就巨大或名声显赫而为其大声欢呼。

ex.chText: 球迷们为自己的球队鼓掌喝彩。
工人们鼓掌欢迎来访者。

synonyms.bx: 指鼓掌欢迎，表示极大的赞同。

ex.chText: 他赢得这场比赛时，人群大声欢呼起来。
ex.enText: The crowd cheered as he won the race.

ex.chText: 球迷们为他们的球队加油。
ex.enText: The fans cheered their team to victory.

synonyms.bx: 指大声呼叫，表示鼓励、祝贺或喝彩。

ex.chText: 支持者兴高采烈地向他们的总统欢呼。
ex.enText: The supporters hailed their president with joy.

ex.chText: 该经理由于支持员工而受到热情赞扬。
ex.enText: The manager was hailed for supporting the staff.

synonyms.bx: 指大声喊出某人的名字或头衔以示喝彩。

ex.chText: 他以甜蜜的吻向她表示问候。
ex.enText: He greeted her with a sweet kiss.
He came up to greet me.

ex.chText: 我代表首相前来迎接您。
ex.enText: I greet you in the name of the Prime Minister.

synonyms.bx: 指用语言和行动打招呼，或友好而热诚地欢迎。

ex.chText: 我的朋友在小溪对岸大声叫我。
ex.enText: My friend hailed me from the other side of the stream.

ex.chText: 经理在酒店门口招呼来宾。
ex.enText: The manager hailed the guests at the door of the hotel.

synonyms.bx: 指为招呼某人或吸引其注意力而大声喊叫。

data.enText: hail from…
to come from or have been born in a particular place
His father hailed from Italy.

tr: many objects thrown forcefully through the air
precipitation of ice pellets when there are strong rising air currents

example: The critics hailed the young pianist as a new Rubinstein

value.def: If a person, event, or achievement is hailed as important or successful, they are praised publicly.

example.ex: Faulkner has been hailed as the greatest American novelist of his generation...
example.tran: 福克纳被誉为他那一代人中最伟大的美国小说家。

example.ex: US magazines hailed her as the greatest rock'n'roll singer in the world...
example.tran: 美国杂志把她奉为世界上最伟大的摇滚歌手。

example.ex: The deal was hailed by the Defence Secretary.
example.tran: 该项协议受到了国防部长的称赞。

value.tran: 赞扬，称颂（人、事件或成就）

value.def: Hail consists of small balls of ice that fall like rain from the sky.

example.ex: ...a sharp short-lived storm with heavy hail.

value.def: When it hails, hail falls like rain from the sky.

example.ex: It started to hail, huge great stones.
example.tran: 开始下雹，而且是很大的雹子。

value.def: A hail of things, usually small objects, is a large number of them that hit you at the same time and with great force.

example.ex: The victim was hit by a hail of bullets...
example.tran: 受害者被一阵弹雨击中。

example.ex: The riot police were met with a hail of stones and petrol bombs.
example.tran: 防暴警察遭到一阵密集的石块和汽油弹的袭击。

value.def: Someone who hails from a particular place was born there or lives there.
If someone or something hails from a particular background, they come from it.

example.ex: He hails from an affluent background...
example.tran: 他出身于一个富有的家庭。

example.ex: This is a film which seems to hail from the hippie era.
example.tran: 这看起来是一部嬉皮士时代的影片。

value.def: If you hail someone, you call to them.

example.ex: Jill saw him and hailed him...
example.tran: 吉尔看到了他，并和他打招呼。

example.ex: Suddenly, a voice hailed us and there was Miss Quigley.
example.tran: 忽然传来一声招呼，原来是奎格利小姐。

value.def: If you hail a taxi, you wave at it in order to stop it because you want the driver to take you somewhere.

example.ex: I hurried away to hail a taxi.

value.def: Hail is used as a word of greeting.

example.ex: Hail to the new champion Bengali D'Albret.
example.tran: 向新科冠军本·贾利·达阿尔布雷致敬。
